contentList.content: As the practitioners of Magecraft from another world, Magi race towards the past– executing what is theoretically possible with science through supernatural means in a bid to reach the “truth.”
The energy that comes about as the refinement of the planet’s Mana or one’s Od by their Magic Circuits. Needed to fuel Magecraft.

As a result of having the Noble Phantasm Avalon inserted into you in your childhood, both your Origin and Element are Sword. Having recently survived the 5th Holy Grail War, you seek to make your dream a reality even in this alternate world.

As a result of your Origin and Element, your precision with the Five Great Elements is limited. You suffer a -[1] penalty to <LSTag Tooltip="SpellDifficultyClass">Spell Save DC</LSTag>, spell <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, and damage with spells from the Evocation, Necromancy, Illusion, and Enchantment schools.

You use Reinforcement Magecraft to bolster your body, increasing the damage of Unarmed Attacks by [1], <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> by [2], <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit point</LSTag> maximum by [3], and <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [4].

Your body has been reinforced. The damage of unarmed attacks is increased by [1], <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> by [2] <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit point</LSTag> maximum is increased by [3], and <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> is increased by [4].

Increases the damage of unarmed attacks is increased by [1], <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> by [2], <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit point</LSTag> maximum by [3], and <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [4].
Reproduce the weapon(s) of a chosen creature in sight with Projection Magecraft.

You become <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with the weapon and any actions associated with the weapon can be performed again without having to take a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. However, as a result of being traced, you suffer a [1] <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> penalty and upon failure of one, if you then fail an <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, your traced weapon will break and disappear.
The spellcaster traced this creature active weapon.

This creature's traced melee weapons suffer a slight degradation, resulting in a -[1] attack roll penalty with attacks using the weapon. Negated when the skills of the weapon's original wielder is emulated.
Trace a weapon previously copied, whose cost is dependent on the weapon's rarity.
This weapon has been remade with the seven steps of tracing, giving you proficiency with the weapon.

Your body is made out of swords. Upon falling or starting your turn under [1] of your hit point maximum, blades will forcibly attempt to stitch up your wounds, automatically healing [2]. However, if a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> is failed, you take [3] damage and start <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BODYOFSWORDS">bleeding internally</LSTag> for 2 turns.

You use Reinforcement Magecraft to enhance your vision and senses, granting <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> as well as allowing you to see in the dark out to a range of [1] and search for <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> creatures up to [2] away.

Can see in the dark up to a range of [1] and attempts to detect <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> creatures up to [2] away, who must succeed a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or lose their invisibility.

You use Reinforcement Magecraft to strengthen your legs, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1], doubling your jumping distance, and allowing you to resist 33% of Falling damage during this turn.
Increases <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1], doubles jumping distance, and allows 33% of Falling damage to be resisted.
Jumping also no longer requires a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> during this turn.
Depending on your currently traced weapon, gain the appropriate Fighting Style if you do not possess it already.

Because of your unique constitution, you can remember any weapons that you lay your eyes on within [1] and reproduce them using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_TraceWeapon_Melee">Trace Weapon: Melee</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_TraceWeapon_Ranged">Trace Weapon: Ranged</LSTag>.
A hidden status used to check for tracing.
Reset cooldown on this traced weapon.

The <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> of the creature the weapon was traced from to be copied if it is higher than yours. However, everytime an attack is then performed, upon failure of an <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, take 20% of <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit point</LSTag> maximum as Force damage.

Allows for the <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> of the creature the weapon was traced from to be copied if it is higher than yours. However, everytime an attack is performed, upon failure of a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, take [1] and [2] as a result of pushing your body past its limits.

You need to toggle this feature after tracing a weapon in order to active this effect. If you have both a ranged and melee traced weapon active, the stats you copy depend on the weapon action being performed.
This creature is emulating the physical parameters of the weapon's original wielder, and may take [1] and [2] as a result of overloading their body's limits.

This creature's traced ranged weapons suffer a slight degradation, resulting in a -[1] attack roll penalty with attacks using the weapon. Negated when the skills of the weapon's original wielder is emulated.

Every turn after tracing a melee weapon, a successful <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> will grant the appropriate fighting style (<LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="FightingStyle_Dueling">Dueling</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="FightingStyle_TwoWeaponFighting">Two-Weapon Fighting</LSTag>, or <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="FightingStyle_GreatWeaponFighting">Great Weapon Fighting</LSTag>) of your current traced melee weapon(s).
You can make an additional free attack with a weapon of a respective type (melee or ranged) after making an attack with a traced weapon of that type.

You use Reinforcement Magecraft on a held traced melee weapon to push it beyond its limits, increasing its damage by [1], giving it [2] more Attack Range, and granting it a +[3] <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> bonus. However, the <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to determine if the traced melee weapon breaks becomes much harder to succeed.

You use Reinforcement Magecraft on a held traced ranged weapon to push it beyond its limits, increasing its damage by [1], giving it [2] more Attack Range, and granting it a +[3] <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> bonus. However, the <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to determine if the traced ranged weapon breaks becomes much harder to succeed.

The damage and range of your traced melee weapon(s) is increased by 1d6 and 33%. Additionally, gain a +2 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, but the <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to determine if the traced melee weapon breaks becomes much harder to succeed.
You use Reinforcement Magecraft to enhance a traced melee weapon to become more arrow-like, allowing it to be fired as a projectile from a bow.

Takes [1] at the start of each turn and has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Turns into regular <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">bleeding</LSTag> after [2] turn[3], allowing it to be removed by healing.

Has the ability to trigger while <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">downed</LSTag>, but deals 20% more damage when failed. If the damage taken is greater than your hit points, become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">downed</LSTag> and fail a Death Saving Throw. Can only trigger [1] time per round.
Magecraft that is expected for all magi to eventually know. These are <LSTag Tooltip="AlwaysPrepared">Always Prepared</LSTag>.
An aria that aids in the self-hypnosis necessary to control your magic circuits.
Magecraft that you are specialized in, revolving around Reinforcement and Projection because of your unique Origin and Element. These are <LSTag Tooltip="AlwaysPrepared">Always Prepared</LSTag>.

The fired arrow deals the damage as the fired weapon plus [1] of the damage of your main-hand bow and needs to be retrieved after landing unless replaced by a new weapon or dismissed. Additionally, the forceful impact can possibly throw enemies <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="OFF_BALANCED">Off Balance</LSTag>.

"--Do not forget. What you must imagine is always that you yourself are the strongest. You do not need outside enemies. For you, the one you have to fight is none other than your own image."

You've taken the final words spoken by Archer to heart. Gain Advantage and a [1] bonus on Intelligence Saving Throws.

You've taken the final words spoken by Archer to heart. Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and a [1] bonus on <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Your prior experience in overcoming the mud of the grail grants you <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being Frightened.

Your experience in surmounting overwhelming odds has honed your instincts. When you are about to be hit by a creature’s melee attack, attempt to parry it with your traced melee weapon and strike back.

Upon success of an <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, reduce the damage of the unarmed attack or weapon attack by [1] and attempt to counterattack with a powerful strike that deals an additional [2] damage. However, upon failure, the image of your traced weapon(s) fail and break.
Strike back with a formidable strike after parrying a creature's melee attack.
The crystalization of the mysteries of heroes and the symbols of their existence.
The symbol of the king, this golden sword changed her fate forever. Its image has protected me long since we parted ways.
[1] wielded with [2] <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, [3] <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, and [4] <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag>.
Make two melee attacks in succession with your equipped weapon using Artoria's immense agility and precision, with the second having a higher chance to critically strike.
Consumed by exhaustion in the aftermath of performing a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_ManaBurst_Caliburn">Mana Burst</LSTag>. Can't move or take actions, bonus actions, or reactions.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Upon performing the mana burst, this creature becomes <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MANABURST_LETHARGY">Mana Exhausted</LSTag> for the rest of their turn.

You infuse the holy sword with a large amount of magical energy and instantly expel it, releasing a concentrated beam of searing light that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SUNBEAM">blinds</LSTag> all creatures in its path.
Charge forward and attack all enemies in your way using Artoria's superhuman speed, possibly pushing them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="OFF_BALANCED">Off Balance</LSTag>.
Strike out at all nearby foes using Artoria's combat prowess, making separate <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag> against each target.
I am the bone of my sword.
Steel is my body, and fire is my blood.
I have created over a thousand blades.
Withstood pain to create many weapons, seeking that parted starlight.
I have no regrets, this is the only path.
My whole life was Unlimited Blade Works.
You've discovered words that resonate in your very being: 'I am the bone of my sword.'
You've discovered more words that resonate in your very being: 'Steel is my body, and fire is my blood.'
You've discovered more words that resonate in your very being: 'I have created over a thousand blades.'
You've discovered more words that resonate in your very being: 'Unaware of beginning.'
You've discovered more words that resonate in your very being: 'Nor aware of end.'
You've discovered more words that resonate in your very being: 'Have withstood pain to create many weapons.'
You've discovered more words that resonate in your very being: 'Always seeking that parted starlight.'
Without a doubt, you've discovered the final words that ties together your very being: 'My whole life was Unlimited Blade Works.'

With each line spoken, gain an alternating +[1] bonus to damage or <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> which stacks with previous lines spoken. Can be cast for a second time during a turn as a bonus action.
Resonating within, these words are meant to connect you.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be wielding a traced melee weapon, see the attacker, and not be Incapacitated or Restrained.
This creature has spoken [1] [2] of their Self Reflecting Aria, increasing their damage by [3].
This creature tried to block with their traced melee weapons, but the reality of the weapons' failure couldn't be recounciled with weapons' image so they disappeared.

With a minimum of 10 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="MagicalEnergy">Magical Energy</LSTag>, this weapon's wielder can pour all of their magical energy into the blade and then immediately expend it to release a Mana Burst. The damage of the beam scales with the amount invested.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> The experiences of this weapon automatically flow into its wielder without proper experience.
Seen by special eyes, the weapon(s) wielded by this creature have been catalogued.
You remember every weapon within [1] of you.
Using Project Magecraft, reproduce weapons that you've seen before whose cost is dependent on rarity.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only trace one set of melee or ranged weapons at a time.
Trace a melee weapon that you've seen before.
Trace a ranged weapon or arrow that you've seen before.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only trace one set melee weapons at a time.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only trace one set ranged weapons at a time.
Trace a weapon that you've seen before from your experience in the Fifth Holy Grail War.
This creature has become proficient with their equipped traced weapons.
Remembered weapons are sorted by rarity first and then weapon type.
You’ve become acquainted with the use of Projection Magecraft. Tracing a weapon restores the bonus action used to cast it, once per round.
Your constant use of Projection Magecraft has elevated you to the level of an expert. Tracing a weapon restores the bonus action used to cast it, twice per round.
You’ve become an undeniable master of Projection Magecraft, a true Specialist. Tracing a weapon restores the bonus action used to cast it, three times per round.
The image of this creature's traced weapons had to be validated after missing.
Dispel your traced [1] weapon by willing its image away.
Having created a [1] weapon out of thin air, this creature surprised their opponent, if only briefly. Attacks using the newly traced weapon gain a +[2] attack roll bonus.
Performing the mana burst depletes all your remaining magical energy, but has increased damage depending on how much extra magical energy was used to charge it.
Blades began to stitch together this creature's body, granting <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to non-magical Slashing and Piercing damage.
'I am the bone of my sword.'
'Steel is my body, and fire is my blood.'
'I have created over a thousand blades.'
'Withstood pain to create many weapons, seeking that parted starlight.'
'I have no regrets, this is the only path.'
'My whole life was Unlimited Blade Works.'
Attempt to apply the effects of your shot arrow.

Using your experience with Projection Magecraft, you seamlessly flow from one weapon to another. Once per turn, after projecting a melee weapon, the actions associated with the weapon do not cost an action.
Functions when this passive is toggled and the desired spell for deletion is being actively prepared, but not yet cast.

Clear your mind of redundant images, erasing them from the selection of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_TraceWeapon_Melee">Trace Weapon (Melee)</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_TraceWeapon_Ranged">Trace Weapon (Ranged)</LSTag>.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Cleared weapons cannot be reacquired after deletion unless seen again.
This creature is ready to clear their mind of redundant images, permanently clearing prepared projections from being cast unless reacquired.

Requires being a Magus.

Use your reaction at the start of combat to automatically cast Reinforcement: Body without expending a bonus action and gain a +1 bonus to Armour Class while your body is reinforced.

Additionally increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1.

Use your reaction at the start of combat to automatically cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ReinforceBody_Interrupt">Reinforcmeent: Body</LSTag> without expending a bonus action and gain a +1 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> while your body is reinforced.

The damage and range of your traced ranged weapon(s) is increased by 1d6 and 33%, but the <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to determine if the traced ranged weapon breaks becomes harder to succeed. Additionally, gain a +2 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Attacks associated with this creature's recently traced melee weapon(s) do not cost an action point.
Attacks associated with this creature's recently traced ranged weapon(s) do not cost an action point.
Follow up your initial attack with another that has a higher chance to score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>.
This creature has spoken [1] [2] of their Self Reflecting Aria, increasing their damage by [3] and gaining a bonus to attack rolls of [4].
This creature is unintentionally copying the physical parameters of the weapon's original wielder, and may take [1] as a result of overloading their body's limits.
Prevents weapon skills aside from Reinforcement: Arrow from being used.
This weapon has been altered by Reinforcement Magecraft to become more arrowlike, thus losing its original functions as a weapon.
You overload a weapon with magical energy, causing it to detonate into a devastating explosion upon impact when fired as an arrow.

The fired arrow deals the damages of the fired weapon and your main-hand bow as force damage to targets caught in a [1] radius as well as additional damage scaling with the rarity of the fired weapon. Additionally, the forceful impact can possibly knock enemies <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Overloaded with magical energy, the fired weapon will explode and disappear upon impact.
Upon speaking the final line of your aria, you project your inner world onto reality with your Reality Marble ｢Unlimited Blade Works｣.

The Reality Marble is deployed at your location with a radius of [1]. While it cannot move from its original location, creatures caught within cannot escape and enemies outside cannot come in or harm those within. Additionally, stabilizing the Reality Marble costs [2] Magical Energy per turn, but while inside, you can trace weapons for no cost and can manipulate traced weapons.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Unlimited Blade Works will end if dismissed, if its user no longer has enough Magical Energy to stabilize it, or if the user walks out of its bounds.
This Reality Marble [1] those within it from those in the outside world.
Trapped within a Reality Marble, this creature cannot be harmed by those in the outside world.
In the outside world, this creature cannot harm those within the Reality Marble.
This creature was pushed away from the border of the Reality Marble.
This creature was pulled back toward the Reality Marble.

Having actualized their Reality Marble, this creature has can trace weapons in it at no cost and gains a +[1] bonus to damage and attack rolls. However, their Magical Energy drains by [2] per turn and if the creature runs out of Magical Energy, dismisses their Reality Marble, or leaves the Reality Marble, the Reality Marble will disappear.
This replicated weapon only exists in this inner world, now brought into reality.
Manipulate seven random weapons stored in ｢Unlimited Blade Works｣ to rain down upon a target inside the Reality Marble.
Each weapon deals its original damage and will reappear at their original location after being manipulated.
Having marked weapons in ｢Unlimited Blade Works｣ to be fired, you can mark a creature to be the target of the sword volley.
｢Unlimited Blade Works｣ Infinite Sword Dance: Fire
This weapon has been marked and is ready to be rained upon an enemy.
This creature can mark a target for their sword volley.
This creature will be the target of a sword volley.
You can mark up to [1] weapons stored in ｢Unlimited Blade Works｣ to be rained down on a creature to deal the damage of each weapon.
｢Unlimited Blade Works｣ Infinite Sword Dance: Trigger
In ｢Unlimited Blade Works｣, you can trace weapons for no cost.
Allows aria to be used once a turn.
Allows aria to be used for a second time during a turn.
Aria can be cast again during a turn using a bonus action.
Fill your Noble Phantasm with every drop of Magical Energy that you have in preparation of performing a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_ManaBurst_Caliburn">Mana Burst</LSTag>.
Any extra Magical Energy consumed will strengthen following attack.
Having charged their weapon with Magical Energy, this creature is primed to perform a Mana Burst.
This creature is locked into doing a Mana Burst this turn.
Having charged their weapon with an excess amount of Magical Energy, this creature is primed to perform a Mana Burst that deals an additional [1].
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Overloaded with magical energy, the Noble Phantasm will break upon release of the Mana Burst.
A sinister, warped dagger unsuited for killing. It well embodies the nature of that black-hooded witch.
[1] with [2] <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, [3] <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, and [4] <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag>.

Lash out with an unseen strike after feigning an opening. Avoid the oncoming attack and attack with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>, scoring a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> upon landing.

As the ultimate anti-magic Noble Phantasm, attacks with this weapon dispel any kind of magic. Summoned creatures will cease to exist, and the <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> of spellcasters will be interrupted.
